meanings.definition: To give up or hand over control or possession
meanings.sent1: She was surrendering her favorite toy to her little sister.
meanings.sent2: The thief was surrendering the stolen goods to the police.
meanings.sent3: After much negotiation, he ended up surrendering his last slice of pizza.
meanings.sent4: In the game of chess, sacrificing a pawn is like surrendering a piece of your army.
meanings.sent5: The soldier knew surrendering his weapon meant giving up the fight.

meanings.definition: To yield or submit to an enemy or opponent
meanings.sent1: The knight was surrendering to the dragon's power.
meanings.sent2: The team decided to surrender the match to their stronger rivals.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be surrendering to the playful puppy's antics.
meanings.sent4: The waves crashing against the shore looked like they were surrendering to the pull of the moon.
meanings.sent5: The defeated warrior was surrendering his sword to the victorious enemy.

meanings.definition: To admit defeat or acknowledge one's inability to resist
meanings.sent1: She was surrendering to the fact that she couldn't solve the puzzle.
meanings.sent2: The boxer raised his hands, surrendering to his opponent's superior skill.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn child finally surrendered to the idea of taking a nap.
meanings.sent4: The wilting flower was surrendering to the inevitable arrival of winter.
meanings.sent5: The detective felt like surrendering to the mystery that seemed unsolvable.

meanings.definition: To abandon oneself to a particular emotion or impulse
meanings.sent1: He was surrendering to the joy of dancing in the rain.
meanings.sent2: The artist surrendered to the inspiration and painted all night.
meanings.sent3: The puppy was surrendering to the temptation of chasing its tail.
meanings.sent4: The musician surrendered to the music and played with all his heart.
meanings.sent5: She felt like surrendering to the laughter bubbling up inside her.
